text: When Abram arrived in Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.
This day will be a day of remembrance for you, which your future generations will celebrate with pilgrimage to the LORD; you will celebrate it as a statute forever.

But the LORD answered Moses: Suppose her father had spit in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be confined outside the camp for seven days; afterwards she may be brought back.

He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy donkeys. He judged Israel for eight years.

because God will bring to judgment every work, with all its hidden qualities, whether good or bad.

Judah’s Neighbors. Thus says the LORD, against all my evil neighbors who plunder the heritage I gave my people Israel as their own: See, I will uproot them from their land; the house of Judah I will uproot in their midst.
All his retinue, his aides and all his troops, I will scatter to the winds and pursue them with the sword.

But the Pharisees went out and took counsel against him to put him to death. The Chosen Servant.

They came and said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are a truthful man and that you are not concerned with anyone’s opinion. You do not regard a person’s status but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it lawful to pay the census tax to Caesar or not? Should we pay or should we not pay?”
He replied to him, “Friend, who appointed me as your judge and arbitrator?”

Penalties of Disobedience. Strive for peace with everyone, and for that holiness without which no one will see the Lord.
But the woman was given the two wings of the great eagle, so that she could fly to her place in the desert, where, far from the serpent, she was taken care of for a year, two years, and a half-year.
